--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Mitchell Timin <zenguyuno@y...> wrote:

Mitchell, you've got some really good ideas for testing
the power of recurrent networks.  Thanks for sharing them.
This experiment, and the one you performed before, can really
help us understand what these networks can do.

> Here is a very basic task a recurrent ANN should be
> able to handle:  
> 
> 1. We generate a random bit string of length N
> 2. We feed it to the ANN one bit at a time, so there
> are N steps here.
> 3. The ANN now repeats the sequence back to you.
> 4. The fitness function is the fraction of correct
> bits.
> 
> How about someone using NEAT for this?  We would like
> to see how the resulting topology varies with N, and
> also how large a value of N can be comfortably handled.
>
